title: Calories in a Taco
meta_description: Learn calories in a taco with a full breakdown of macros, protein, fat, carbs, and tips for variations to fit your diet.
assumptions: Standard beef taco: corn tortilla, 1 oz cooked ground beef, 0.5 oz cheddar cheese, shredded lettuce, diced tomato, salsa; no sour cream or guacamole.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by ingredients, portion sizes, preparation, and brands. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A standard taco provides about 200 kcal and 12 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant items.

tweaks.label: Use flour tortilla instead of corn

faqs.q: How many calories in a beef taco?
faqs.a: About 200 kcal for a standard beef taco with corn tortilla and basic toppings.

faqs.q: What are the macros in a taco?
faqs.a: Typically 20 g carbs, 12 g protein, 10 g fat, with 3 g fiber.
Yes, around 400 mg per taco due to cheese, salsa, and seasonings.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in a taco?
faqs.a: Skip cheese or sour cream, use lettuce wrap instead of tortilla, or choose leaner protein.

faqs.q: Calories in a chicken taco vs beef?
faqs.a: Chicken tacos are often 20-50 kcal lower per taco due to less fat in the meat.
